headline: These Democrats Want To Smother Biden's Mask Mandates. Like In A Ventilator.
author: Stephen Robinson
sentences: This was a bipartisan middle finger to President Joe Biden’s public health measures: The eight Democrats who somehow thought it was a good idea to vote for anything Rand Paul initiated were Joe Manchin from West Virginia, Jon Tester from Montana, Michael Bennet from Colorado, Jacky Rosen and Catherine Cortez Masto from Nevada, Maggie Hassan from New Hampshire, Mark Kelly from Arizona, and Kyrsten Sinema from Sinemaland.

"I think we ought to consider it, the question is: when?”
The science doesn’t indicate that COVID-19 is less virulent in swing states or districts, so “vulnerable” Democrats retreating on sensible COVID-19 policies just before midterms look craven and opportunistic.

Kelly, Bennet, Cortez Masto and Hassan are all up for reelection this year, and as the resolution moves to the House, where Democrats have a narrow majority and Republicans are even crazier, some moderate Democrats have already come out against masks.

PREVIOUSLY: Rand Paul Still Trying To Fire Dr. Fauci, Because What The F*ck Is Wrong With These People
Paul forced the vote using the Congressional Review Act, which allows senators to overturn federal agencies’ regulations by a simple majority vote.

Although COVID-19 cases are plummeting across the nation, the Biden administration had extended the mandate through April 18 and planned to work with the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention on a revised policy framework.

The self-made ophthalmologist seemed to think that a Senate resolution can stamp out COVID permanently: "We have it within our power today to ensure the American people that we are irreversibly going back to normal."

According to Leonard J. Marcus, director of the Aviation Public Health Initiative at Harvard University, one person wearing a mask reduces their chance of contracting or spreading COVID-19 by 50 percent.
The Senate instead joined Paul’s rejection of facial coverings, which actual medical experts consider one of the most effective public health measures to prevent transmission of the coronavirus.

"If, based on science, [airplanes are] just as safe as anywhere else, then we should be considering it," said Rep. Elissa Slotkin (D-Mich.).
If Paul’s resolution passes the Democratic-controlled House, Biden is prepared to veto, but that’s hardly the intra-party showdown we need.
